oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lakeshore Home for the Aged, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1957, Vol. 5 p. 86
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Lakeshore Home for the Aged, June 1957. Opened in 1952, the home was operated by a group from Nashville-Middle Tennessee Churches of Christ, and it was located at 832 Grove Avenue. An addition to the home was constructed several years after it opened. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1957. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
